title: Early Game Strategy!!! (Ranked)
body:
Ok so this is my first forum and i hope you like it.

I have seen this strategy being used once or twice and it has been very very effective.
The enemy team used it against mine and the early game headstart let my team lose. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Strategy:

-Group up bot lane take kills 4 go in cept top
-AT LEAST 2 tanks (1 being early tank)
-after bot DEMOLISHED get dragon
-check their blue and go back to lanes

-Group top 3 go in (excluding bot lane)
-top shouldve been building tank and goes in
-others gank from front and back and kill top laner
-Go back to lanes or recall under turret

-Team Comp-

Mid- Kat
Top- Malph
Jg- Wu/Jarvan
Adc- Miss Fortune
Support- Braum/Leona


Jungle + Support early tank/HP build
---------------------------------------------------
Late game wombo combo timing:

Malphite ults
Braum/Leona ults
Wukong/Jarvan ults
Kat ults
miss fortune ults


Kat or MF fed= GG

INSTA WIN
----------------------------------------------------
Important:

-Learn champions
-Practice combo in normals
-Try Ranked
-If you do well...WIN
---------------------------------------------------
Early Game strategy:

Support and Top take 2 HP pods and Health crystal
Rest of the team take Purple wards and anything else they need
Place purple wards around lvl 4+ (make sure you have it placed at all times)
Now you have clear vision of their jungler, freely try getting early kill on bot lane
If you dont buy purple ward, their jungler can kill at least 2 of your team mates
dont worry 2-2 not a big difference especially if your ADC gets both kills
---------------------------------------------------

If you are countered try to farm under turret/ harrass enemy less
kepe going until your team decides to crush top or bot lane


Why not mid lane?
-2 bushes= 2 wards not always but usually early game
-Mid lane levels up faster than other lanes
-Mid lane is the fastest to get to
-Mid lane can be used as a late game lane where you wombo combo 
-Mid lane= Help coming form top and bot

These are my opinions but if you want,go for it, gank mid


This is what i have seen happening and works really well believe it or not
I'm a bronze myself setting up a ranked 5v5 team with my friends soon and hopefully we are successful and maybe you are too!

Thanks,

InsidiousDrifter

replies.body:
I Think you're over thinking it wayy to much, if you're going to play with 5 friends the best way to climb in my opinion is to pick really strong early-mid champions (better if they have a wombo together) I like team comps that have a really strong top lane champion that can receive ganks well e.g. Naut, Trundle, and then pairing him with a really strong jungler who can gank well e.g. Lee Sin makes it really easy to get kills and if you manage to snowball top it makes 2v2 3v3 4v4s and 5v5s around dragon really easy.

Also if you want to climb low elo and you're not that much better than everyone else cheese like crazy gank top and then sit in the brush facing golems with the top laner and kill the enemy top again (if you know you're strong enough), If you pick a strong jungler like Lee or Nid lvl 2 invade if you know you can win 1v1 or at least steal the buff. If you gank a lane early and burn their flash just keep doing laps around the lane.

I think one of the biggest things lower elo players don't try to implement into their game is getting advantages that are not reflected by score, for example burning enemy flashes or crucial ultimates. One example I can think of is lvl 2 invading but instead of trying to get a kill just take the buff, it's a lot easier to just get the buff as you have the element of surprise, and this will slow the jungler down.
